triageFlags.title: Credit Score in Tier C
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in Tier C, which requires stricter lending criteria.
triageFlags.recommendation: Ensure all Tier C requirements, including minimum deposit and affordability checks, are met.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, a credit score of 550 falls into Tier C, necessitating stricter lending criteria to mitigate risk.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Near Maximum Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio is close to the maximum allowable threshold for Tier C.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify income and expenses to ensure the applicant can afford the loan.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 35% for Tier C applicants. The current DTI of 31.43% is within limits but close to the threshold, warranting careful review.

content.reasoning: The applicant's credit score categorizes them as Tier C, necessitating stricter criteria. The Debt-to-Income ratio is within the acceptable range but close to the limit, indicating potential affordability concerns. The vehicle and loan structure comply with policy requirements.
